concepts.name: Inverse Variation
concepts.description: A type of relationship where one variable increases as the other decreases, modeled by equations such as y = k/x.

concepts.name: Graphing Inverse Variation
concepts.description: Graphing relationships that exhibit inverse variation, showing hyperbolic curves with asymptotes.

concepts.name: Rational Functions
concepts.description: Functions represented as ratios of polynomials, characterized by specific behaviors like asymptotes and excluded values.

concepts.name: Asymptotes in Graphs
concepts.description: Understanding vertical, horizontal, and slant asymptotes in rational function graphs and their significance.

concepts.name: Simplifying Rational Expressions
concepts.description: Reducing rational expressions to their simplest form by factoring and canceling common terms.

concepts.name: Excluded Values
concepts.description: Values that make the denominator of a rational expression zero, which must be excluded from the domain.

concepts.name: Division of Polynomials
concepts.description: Performing polynomial long division and synthetic division to simplify rational functions.

concepts.name: Multiplication and Division of Rational Expressions
concepts.description: Multiplying and dividing rational expressions by factoring and canceling common factors.

concepts.name: Addition and Subtraction of Rational Expressions
concepts.description: Combining rational expressions with like and unlike denominators by finding the least common denominator.

concepts.name: Solving Rational Equations
concepts.description: Eliminating denominators to solve equations involving rational expressions using methods like cross-multiplication.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Rational Functions
concepts.description: Using rational equations to model and solve problems in physics, engineering, and economics.

concepts.name: Statistical Sampling Methods
concepts.description: Different sampling techniques like random and stratified sampling to collect data for statistical studies.

concepts.name: Biased Samples and Questions
concepts.description: Identifying and avoiding bias in sample selection and survey question phrasing to ensure accurate results.

concepts.name: Survey Design and Implementation
concepts.description: Steps to create effective surveys, including determining goals, selecting sample populations, and analyzing data.
